meanings.definition: Existing or residing within something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The indwelling spirit of kindness guided her actions.
meanings.sent2: The indwelling warmth of the sun made the room cozy.
meanings.sent3: The indwelling sense of adventure in the cat led it to explore new places.
meanings.sent4: His indwelling creativity sparked new ideas in the team.
meanings.sent5: The indwelling joy in her heart shone through her smile.

meanings.sent1: The indwelling beauty of the landscape captivated all who saw it.
meanings.sent2: His indwelling talent for music was evident from a young age.
meanings.sent3: The indwelling curiosity of the child led to many questions about the world.
meanings.sent4: The indwelling strength of the tree roots kept it firmly in place during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The indwelling wisdom of the elder was sought by many in the village.
